verses.text:
And Hannah prayed , and said , My heart rejoiceth in the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, mine horn is exalted in the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*: my mouth is enlarged over mine enemies ; because I rejoice in thy salvation.
\add There is\add* none holy as the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: for \add there is\add* none beside thee: neither \add is there\add* any rock like our God.

Talk no more so exceeding proudly ; let \add not\add* arrogancy come out of your mouth : for the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add is\add* a God of knowledge , and by him actions are weighed.\f + \fr 2.3 \ft arrogancy: Heb. hard\f*
The bows of the mighty men \add are\add* broken , and they that stumbled are girded with strength.
\add They that were\add* full have hired out themselves for bread ; and \add they that were\add* hungry ceased : so that the barren hath born seven ; and she that hath many children is waxed feeble.
The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* killeth , and maketh alive : he bringeth down to the grave , and bringeth up.
The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* maketh poor , and maketh rich : he bringeth low , and lifteth up.

He raiseth up the poor out of the dust , \add and\add* lifteth up the beggar from the dunghill , to set \add them\add* among princes , and to make them inherit the throne of glory : for the pillars of the earth \add are\add* the \nd \+w LORD’s|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and he hath set the world upon them.
He will keep the feet of his saints , and the wicked shall be silent in darkness ; for by strength shall no man prevail.

The adversaries of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* shall be broken to pieces ; out of heaven shall he thunder upon them: the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* shall judge the ends of the earth ; and he shall give strength unto his king , and exalt the horn of his anointed. \p
And Elkanah went to Ramah to his house. And the child did minister unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* before Eli the priest. \p
¶ Now the sons of Eli \add were\add* sons of Belial ; they knew not the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.

And the priests’ custom with the people \add was, that\add*, when any man offered sacrifice , the priest’s servant came , while the flesh was in seething , with a fleshhook of three teeth in his hand ;

And he struck \add it\add* into the pan , or kettle , or caldron , or pot ; all that the fleshhook brought up the priest took for himself. So they did in Shiloh unto all the Israelites that came thither.
Also before they burnt the fat , the priest’s servant came , and said to the man that sacrificed , Give flesh to roast for the priest ; for he will not have sodden flesh of thee, but raw.

And \add if\add* any man said unto him, Let them not fail to burn the fat presently , and \add then\add* take \add as much\add* as thy soul desireth ; then he would answer him, \add Nay;\add* but thou shalt give \add it me\add* now: and if not, I will take \add it\add* by force.\f + \fr 2.16 \ft presently: Heb. as on the day\f*

Wherefore the sin of the young men was very great before the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*: for men abhorred the offering of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*. \p
¶ But Samuel ministered before the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, \add being\add* a child , girded with a linen ephod.
Moreover his mother made him a little coat , and brought \add it\add* to him from year to year , when she came up with her husband to offer the yearly sacrifice. \p

¶ And Eli blessed Elkanah and his wife , and said , The 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* give thee seed of this woman for the loan which is lent to the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*. And they went unto their own home.  +  r 2.20  t loan…: or, petition which she asked, etc *

And the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* visited Hannah , so that she conceived , and bare three sons and two daughters. And the child Samuel grew before the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*. \p

¶ Now Eli was very old , and heard all that his sons did unto all Israel ; and how they lay with the women that assembled \add at\add* the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.\f + \fr 2.22 \ft assembled: Heb. assembled by troops\f*
And he said unto them, Why do ye such things ? for I hear of your evil dealings by all this people.\f + \fr 2.23 \ft of your…: or, evil words of you\f*
Nay, my sons ; for \add it is\add* no good report that I hear : ye make the \nd \+w LORD’s|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* people to transgress.\f + \fr 2.24 \ft transgress: or, cry out\f*

If one man sin against another , the judge shall judge him: but if a man sin against the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, who shall intreat for him? Notwithstanding they hearkened not unto the voice of their father , because the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* would slay them.
And the child Samuel grew on , and was in favour both with the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and also with men. \p

¶ And there came a man of God unto Eli , and said unto him, Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, Did I plainly appear unto the house of thy father , when they were in Egypt in Pharaoh’s house ?

And did I choose him out of all the tribes of Israel \add to be\add* my priest , to offer upon mine altar , to burn incense , to wear an ephod before me? and did I give unto the house of thy father all the offerings made by fire of the children of Israel ?

Wherefore kick ye at my sacrifice and at mine offering , which I have commanded \add in my\add* habitation ; and honourest thy sons above me, to make yourselves fat with the chiefest of all the offerings of Israel my people ?

Wherefore the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* God of Israel saith , I said indeed \add that\add* thy house , and the house of thy father , should walk before me for ever : but now the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* saith , Be it far from me ; for them that honour me I will honour , and they that despise me shall be lightly esteemed.
Behold, the days come , that I will cut off thine arm , and the arm of thy father’s house , that there shall not be an old man in thine house.

And thou shalt see an enemy \add in my\add* habitation , in all \add the wealth\add* which \add God\add* shall give Israel : and there shall not be an old man in thine house for ever.\f + \fr 2.32 \ft an enemy…: or, the affliction of the tabernacle, for all the wealth which God would have given Israel\f*

And the man of thine, \add whom\add* I shall not cut off from mine altar , \add shall be\add* to consume thine eyes , and to grieve thine heart : and all the increase of thine house shall die in the flower of their age.\f + \fr 2.33 \ft in the flower…: Heb. men\f*
And this \add shall be\add* a sign unto thee, that shall come upon thy two sons , on Hophni and Phinehas ; in one day they shall die both of them.

And I will raise me up a faithful priest , \add that\add* shall do according to \add that\add* which \add is\add* in mine heart and in my mind : and I will build him a sure house ; and he shall walk before mine anointed for ever.

And it shall come to pass, \add that\add* every one that is left in thine house shall come \add and\add* crouch to him for a piece of silver and a morsel of bread , and shall say , Put me, I pray thee, into one of the priests’ offices , that I may eat a piece of bread.\f + \fr 2.36 \ft Put: Heb. Join\f*\f + \fr 2.36 \ft one of…: or, somewhat about the priesthood\f*
